name: Financial Services Commission (FSC)
description: The Financial Services Commission (FSC) is the integrated regulator for the non-banking financial services sector in the Republic of Mauritius. It supervises and oversees the regulation of securities, insurance, pension funds, global business, forex brokers and other non-bank financial intermediaries to ensure market integrity, investor protection and financial stability.

meta.title: The Mauritius Advantage: How the FSC is Reshaping Offshore Forex Regulation

bottomline: The FSC isn’t trying to be the UK’s FCA—and that’s its strength. By focusing on jurisdictionally appropriate oversight with globally aligned principles, it has created what I call the "Goldilocks offshore": rigorous enough to deter bad actors, pragmatic enough to attract serious brokers.
